action.primary: Calms the Liver, anchors Yang and sedates fright and Calms convulsions.

indications: Liver Yang Rising or Deranged Heart Yang with dizziness, vertigo, palpitations and insomnia

action.primary: Clears the Liver, cools Heat and brightens the eyes

indications: Red, swollen eyes with superficial visual obstruction, macula in children, cataracts, nebulae
Edema, leg Qi, hematuria, urinary retention

contraindications: Use caution for those with weak digestion.

useCases: Liver Yang Rising with dizziness, vertigo, palpitations and insomnia
Blazing Liver Fire affecting the eyes
Red, swollen, painful eyes with superficial visual obstruction
For poxes in children entering the eyes
Palpitations, irritability, insomnia, dream-disturbed sleep or infantile convulsions due to high fever
Wind and Heat in the Liver channel manifested as red, swollen and painful eyes or visual obstructions
Hyperactivity of Liver Yang manifested as dizziness, vertigo and headache

notes: The drug is collected in summer, removed from muscles, washed clean, and dried in the sun.
This herb treats superficial obstruction due to Toxic Heat, spots and rashes in children threatening the eyes and night terrors preventing sleep.
The white parts are said to enter the Qi level and the purple parts enter the Blood level.
It facilitates and unblocks water channels, drives out toxins and descends blood.
This herb is used to resolve and eliminate all urinary blockage, edema, leg Qi, macular rashes and superficial visual obstruction in children and toxins.
It is used as drops for superficial visual obstruction.

Both Zi Bei Chi and Fossilia Dentis Mastodi #{LongGu} Long Chi enter the Liver channel, calm the Liver, anchor Yang and sedate fright, Zi Bei Chi is neutral, is better at anchoring Yang and brightens the eyes, while Long Chi is heavier and more astringent and better at sedating and quieting and is able to stabilize and bind.
Calcined Cowry Shell Duan Zi Bei Chi is processed and used as eye drops.
It is also known as Bei Ci or Zi Bei.
